page.title: 04WHERE TO GO IN FLEETWOOD.
page.content: Any visitor to Fleetwood will notice its fine, wide streets. Worth noting, too, are their names. In this block alone, 6 are named for local rivers, 4 for lakes, 6 for connections with royalty, 7 for poets and 15 for characters or places in the plays of Shakespeare,who of course has a street named after him. The purely decorative light-house is classically named the Pharos. These names illustrate the care with which the town was planned. Marine and civil engineers will want to visit the docks, ferry and{Maritime {Museum}and travel on one of the country's few remaining tram systems; sports-lovers will want to visit the {Marine Hall, Lake Complex}and{Leisure {Centre}; shoppers will want to visit {Fleetwood Market}and{Lord Street}and everyone will want to visit the little gem of Fleetwood, the{Memorial Park}.
